channel.title: web on Edwin Kofler
channel.description: Recent content in web on Edwin Kofler

item.title: Frontend Web Development: My First Year
item.description: So I was reintroduced to programming during the fall of 2017. I was learning Java in my AP Computer Science A class. The class was another one of those “college-level” “advanced placement” (AP) classes, which actually became really fun near the end. You see, I was finishing up a really fun final project (written in Java). It was basically an anagram finder, with a few extra features (including local multiplayer). I had so much fun making it.

item.title: Developing my Robotics Teams' Website
item.description: During the November of 2018, I became aware of a website competition. I had the opportunity to submit a website that showcased my robotics club by mid-January. Website creation tools (like ones from Wix or Weebly) were not prohibited. After learning this, I thought this competition would be perfect to apply the frontend skills that I recently learned! I knew I probably wasn’t going to win, but I wanted to give it my best shot.
